title: Technical documentation for high-risk AI systems

article_refs.quote: The technical documentation of a high-risk AI system shall be drawn up before that system is placed on the market or put into service and shall be kept up-to date.

legal_consequence.verbatim: The technical documentation of a high-risk AI system shall be drawn up before that system is placed on the market or put into service and shall be kept up-to date.

items.label: Purpose and contents
items.text: Documentation must demonstrate compliance with Section 2 requirements and include, at a minimum, the elements in Annex IV (simplified form may be used by SMEs/start-ups).

items.label: Single documentation set for Annex I(A) products
items.text: Where applicable product law applies (Annex I Section A), draw up a single set of technical documentation covering this Regulation and product law.

items.label: Delegated acts to amend Annex IV
items.text: The Commission may amend Annex IV via delegated acts to ensure sufficiency for compliance assessment.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for nonâ€‘compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).

question.prompt: Does Article 2 scope apply (and no exclusion)?
Is the actor a provider per Art. 3(2)?
Is the AI system high-risk under Art. 6?
Is the system high-risk solely via Art. 6(1) and covered by Annex I Section B legislation?
